transportAdvice: Public bus services connect the main towns and some beaches but coverage is limited and infrequent, making a rental car or scooter the most practical way to explore the island; taxis are available in larger towns like Argostoli but should be arranged in advance in more remote areas.

weather.description: Cool and wet with frequent rain showers; the island is quiet and most tourist facilities are closed.
Similar to January with continued rainfall and mild temperatures; very few tourists and limited services open.
Early signs of spring with slightly warmer days and decreasing rain; a pleasant time for hiking with green landscapes.
Mild and increasingly sunny with occasional showers; wildflowers bloom and the island begins to wake up for the season.
Warm and mostly sunny with very little rain; an excellent time to visit before the summer crowds arrive.
Hot and reliably sunny with minimal rainfall; beaches are busy and sea temperatures become comfortable for swimming.
Peak summer heat with long sunny days and virtually no rain; expect busy beaches and the highest tourist numbers.
Equally hot as July with intense sunshine; the island is at its most crowded and accommodation should be booked well in advance.
Warm and still very sunny with the sea at its warmest; crowds thin out making this one of the best months to visit.
Pleasantly warm early in the month with increasing cloud and occasional rain later; a good shoulder season option.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn sets in; most tourist businesses close and the island returns to a quiet local pace.
Cool and rainy with short days; the island is very quiet and primarily of interest to those seeking an off-season escape.
